order: Pine Ridge High School Site Park
Crystal City Shuttle to Lincoln Memorial
National Mall, Sculpture Garden North Entrance
National Mall, View of the Capitol

Artisphere Ballroom.name: Artisphere Ballroom
Artisphere Ballroom.flavor_text: Welcome to the 75th Annual Famine Game!  This app will be your trusty companion to help you survive inside this year's arena.

GolfDC Academy.name: GolfDC Academy
GolfDC Academy.flavor_text: Please be at GolfDC Academy tomorrow morning no later than 8:45 AM. Turn right into the parking lot by the clubhouse and park in the one southeast-most from clubhouse.  Hover over "View" next to Map to see more detail. Game will start promptly at 9AM.  Make sure all your devices are fully charged!!

Hains Point.name: Hains Point
Hains Point.flavor_text: Welcome to the 75th Annual Famine Game. When instructed, please proceed to your starting region and remain there until the countdown concludes. Do not leave early.  You will explode. May the odds be ever in your favor.
Hains Point.notes: Start codes = bloodbath, rules, fight, finish
Hains Point.parking_description: Park in the large lot at the southern tip of the peninsula.

George Mason Memorial.name: George Mason Memorial
George Mason Memorial.flavor_text:
You grabbed what you could from the Arena and fled. You need to get away and take a moment to find your bearings. Time to head for a clearing to rest and figure out your next move.

Head north along the western part of the peninsula and park in Memorial Lot A (if full, try B or C). Walk north to the George Mason Memorial.
George Mason Memorial.parking_description: Memorial Lots A, B, C are a 5 minute walk to the memorial. A is your closest option.
George Mason Memorial.restroom_description: Restrooms are nearby at the Jefferson Memorial

Thomas Jefferson Memorial.name: Thomas Jefferson Memorial
Thomas Jefferson Memorial.flavor_text: Don't return to your vehicles just yet! You need to find some sort of weapon to defend yourself. Head to the memorial of Jamesson Hoffert, one of the founders of Pangram, and find something to create a makeshift weapon. Anything will do, even a sharpened stick! Walk northeast to the Jefferson Memorial.
Thomas Jefferson Memorial.parking_description: Memorial Lots A, B, C are a 5 minute walk to the memorial. A is your closest option.
Thomas Jefferson Memorial.restroom_description: Restooms are beneath the Jefferson Memorial

Thomas Jefferson Memorial, Part Two.name: Thomas Jefferson Memorial, Part Two
Thomas Jefferson Memorial, Part Two.flavor_text:
You need to stay mobile, so it might be a good time to think about transportation. Looking around, you marvel at the wide variety of options. Man-powered boats in the water, planes flying overhead, and cars all around you. Perhaps one of those will help.

Return to the Piecekeepers and tell them you need a ride.
Thomas Jefferson Memorial, Part Two.parking_description: Memorial Lots A, B, C are a 5 minute walk to the memorial. A is your closest option.
Thomas Jefferson Memorial, Part Two.restroom_description: Restooms are beneath the Jefferson Memorial

Roosevelt Island.name: Roosevelt Island
Roosevelt Island.flavor_text:
Unfortunately, killing off Briny Deep totaled your vehicle. And even though you have a blanket, you're not going to last long without building a fire. Make your way north to a wooded island where hopefully you'll find some materials you can use.

Head to Roosevelt Island in Virginia. Be alert because it's easy to screw up navigation here. The entrance is to the right off the George Washington Parkway. If you miss it, you'll have quite a ways to double back. After you've entered the lot and parked your vehicle, walk across the bridge to Roosevelt Island and make your way to the center of the island near the large statue.
Roosevelt Island.parking_description: There is a small parking lot on the east side of the street.  This parking lot only has one entrance.
Roosevelt Island.restroom_description: There is a portable toilet at the end of the parking lot.

George Washington Masonic Memorial.name: George Washington Masonic Memorial
George Washington Masonic Memorial.flavor_text:
Oh no! The career teams have spotted the smoke from your fire too and are headed your way. You need to run! Head south along the river to help hide your tracks and find a place to hide. Maybe amongst those old stone ruins you can see in the distance.

To get to this location, you'll need to turn right out of the parking lot, head north, and U-turn back south after a mile or so.
George Washington Masonic Memorial.parking_description: There are free lots right next to the Memorial.
George Washington Masonic Memorial.restroom_description: Inside the Memorial, ask the staff for precise directions

National Harbor, Awakening Statue.name: National Harbor, Awakening Statue
National Harbor, Awakening Statue.flavor_text:
What's going on? A moment ago it was freezing and now suddenly it is blisteringly hot. You have a headache and your mouth is so dry it hurts. You need to find some water, and fast! You can see a clearing up ahead with a gentle slope that will allow easy access to the water.

Park in one of the parking garages near the water at National Harbor and then make your way towards the water. Proceed down the stairs, and find the statue of Peeta burying himself in the mud during the 74th Famine Game. It's located between two piers.
National Harbor, Awakening Statue.restroom_description: There are restrooms in many of the restaurants in the harbor.

Lake Accotink Park, Picnic Area 3.name: Lake Accotink Park, Picnic Area 3
Lake Accotink Park, Picnic Area 3.flavor_text: As the adrenaline from your last encounter begins to fade, you start to finally notice how hungry you really are.   You're starting to feel weak and listless.  You won't last much longer without finding something to eat.  You can see the open pasture up to the north where the Feast is about to begin.  You know it isn't safe, but you're getting desperate.
Lake Accotink Park, Picnic Area 3.parking_description: The main lot is fairly small and may fill up. There is a much larger lot slightly farther away near where you'll come into the park.

Pine Ridge High School Site Park.name: Pine Ridge High School Site Park
Pine Ridge High School Site Park.flavor_text:
Your stomachs are really starting to growl now as the hunger pangs intensify. You really need to find some food, but the Feast is just not a safe place to be. Maybe there's a place you can forage for something to eat up ahead.

Drive all the way to the end of the parking lot, park there, and head down the path.
Pine Ridge High School Site Park.parking_description: There is a large gravel lot that is free to park in.
Pine Ridge High School Site Park.restroom_description: There is a portable toilet at the end of the parking lot.

Glen Echo Park, Ballroom Cafe.name: Glen Echo Park, Ballroom Cafe
Glen Echo Park, Ballroom Cafe.flavor_text:
You're finally starting to feel better. You're well fed, and you haven't actually died yet, which is a definite plus. You head up a hill and find what appears to be an abandoned amusement park.

Park in the public lot and make your way into the park. Head past the carousel and look for a Piecekeeper inside the small cafe.
Glen Echo Park, Ballroom Cafe.parking_description: A free parking lot for Glen Echo Park is located just off MacArthur Boulevard on Oxford Road, across from the Glen Echo Shopping Center. From the parking lot, follow the foot-bridge across the Minnehaha Creek to enter the Park.

Kennedy Center, Upper Balcony.name: Kennedy Center, Upper Balcony
Kennedy Center, Upper Balcony.flavor_text:
During each Famine Game, the Capitol holds an exclusive gala for its most influential citizens. It's probably in your best interest to try and curry favor with someone powerful. Head there now and start rubbing elbows. Warning: as this portion of the Arena allows for contact between Tributes and Capitol citizens, you will need to be on your best behavior or face swift "disqualification". Do not disturb the citizens!

Depending on the height of your vehicle, you may not be able to park in the Kennedy Center lot. We suggest you XXXXXX. When you arrive, make your way up to the upper balcony exit towards the Potomac River, and find your sponsor.
Kennedy Center, Upper Balcony.parking_description: You can park in the Kennedy Center garage if there's space, but it costs $20. Additionally, there is nearby street parking, though it may be hard to find.

Dawson Terrace Community Center.name: Dawson Terrace Community Center
Dawson Terrace Community Center.flavor_text: You're sure the horrible screeching noise that just occurred will draw the attention of other teams.  Best to head into the woods and try to lay low for a bit.
Dawson Terrace Community Center.parking_description: Park on the street near the community center.

Victory Comics.name: Victory Comics
Victory Comics.address: 586 S. Washington St., Falls Church, VA 22046
Victory Comics.flavor_text:
It's time to turn this thing around. You're going to need to get aggressive if you hope to survive this. There is a large alliance making camp not too far from here. You need to see if you can't sabotage them somehow. Anything to slow them down will help.

Park, enter the store, and find the nearest Piecekeeper.
Victory Comics.parking_description: Free parking lot next to the store

Nottingham Drive Residence.name: Nottingham Drive Residence
Nottingham Drive Residence.flavor_text:
Now that that grisly business is done, it's time to once again move on. Perhaps if you head into the modern day labyrinth of Suburbia you can shake any potential teams stalking you.

A word of caution: in such a dense urban environment, danger could be waiting to ambush you around any corner. You should probably be as quiet as possible (also, people may be trying to sleep).

Drive to the address listed, park on the street, and make your way around the left side of the house to the back yard.

Sushi Location.name: Sushi Location
Sushi Location.flavor_text: You're stomach is starting to growl again.  It's time to find some more food before your hunger becomes a liability.

Penwood Drive Residence.name: Penwood Drive Residence
Penwood Drive Residence.flavor_text:
Perhaps you need to find a safe place to collect your thoughts. So far you've been left relatively alone in the suburban environ. But, as common wisdom dictates, you shouldn't stay in one spot for very long.

Head south. You will find yourself in a similar environment. Again, park on the street and if after hours, please remain as quiet as possible. Be cautious of van door slamming, loud chatter, etc.

Mining Artifact Location.name: Mining Artifact Location
Mining Artifact Location.flavor_text: It's getting late.  You're tired, you've been through so much, and you're not sure how much more you can take.  Despite this, though, you're in surprisingly high spirits.  Who would've thought you would make it this far, relatively unscathed?  Only about 1/4th of the teams remain and you're in a pretty good position to keep going strong.  Maybe you'll survive this yet.

Dennys.name: Dennys
Dennys.flavor_text:
There's only one major alliance of teams left. They've been hoarding a big cache of grain. If you destroy their supplies, they'll be weak and disoriented enough that they shouldn't prove too much of a challenge.

Park, make your way inside, and get a table. If you're going to solve this puzzle on location, please order some food.

Olde Towne Pet Resort.name: Olde Towne Pet Resort
Olde Towne Pet Resort.flavor_text: Now there're only two careers teams left.  Time to go on the offensive and hunt them down.

GW Community School.name: GW Community School
GW Community School.flavor_text: Looks like it's time to get out of here. Strange that they haven't sent a transport yet . . . Look for the brown building marked "Best Academy - Fairfax GT Center". Enter through the rightmost door on the eastern side of the building. Follow the hallway down to the end and enter the double glass doors on the left.

Courtyard Marriott Alexandria Old Town.name: Courtyard Marriott Alexandria Old Town
Courtyard Marriott Alexandria Old Town.flavor_text:
The location of District 13 has been uploaded to your App, but it's heavily encrypted. You'll need to get the password from our agent in order to decrypt it.

For security purposes, the only agent who knows the password has to stay mobile, so you'll have to meet him at his current safe house. Unfortunately, there may be a snag. The agent is supposed to check in every week, but he is two days overdue. Be careful, you may be walking into a trap.

Motley Fool.name: Motley Fool
Motley Fool.flavor_text:
So the rumors were true, District 13 really does exist! Now you just need to make your way there and figure out what's really going on.

Park on the street and go to the front of the building. Security is tight, so you'll need to be escorted in by a Piecekeeper. Don't worry, they're just as sick of the Capitol's abuses as we are and have been working with us for a while now. Call the number posted on the door and give them the passcode "fort".

Motley Fool.name: Motley Fool
Motley Fool.flavor_text:
If we want the revolution to succeed, we'll need to win the hearts and the minds of the people.

Return to the administrator's desk, and get them to show you where the studio is.

Motley Fool.name: Motley Fool
Motley Fool.flavor_text: Return to the administrator's desk. Apparently there's someone who would like to meet you.

Crystal City Shuttle to Lincoln Memorial.name: Crystal City Shuttle to Lincoln Memorial
Crystal City Shuttle to Lincoln Memorial.address: 2 Lincoln Memorial Cir NW, Washington, DC 20037
Crystal City Shuttle to Lincoln Memorial.flavor_text:
You're doing so well, the Resistance wants to send you on a secret mission into the Capitol.

Park your car in the free lot. A member of the resistance should be there to shuttle your team into the city.
Crystal City Shuttle to Lincoln Memorial.restroom_description: Look for the door to the left of the stairs as you're facing the monument from the reflecting pool.

Martin Luther King Jr. Memorial.name: Martin Luther King Jr. Memorial
Martin Luther King Jr. Memorial.flavor_text:
Walk south and visit a large stone structure commemorating the time inspirational leader Thrumkitjin Garner broke free from Capitol oppression.

The memorial is located to the south, and it will be on your left, near the Tidal Basin.

FDR Memorial.name: FDR Memorial
FDR Memorial.address: 1850 West Basin Dr SW, Washington, DC 20242
FDR Memorial.flavor_text: As news of your exploits begins to spread, more and more people have joined your cause. With the number of resistance members you have on your side, you can now do some real damage.Keep walking south and enter the FDR Memorial. Look for the Piecekeeper by the waterfall and tell them you're ready to open the floodgates.

FDR Memorial, Part Two.name: FDR Memorial, Part Two
FDR Memorial, Part Two.address: 1850 West Basin Dr SW, Washington, DC 20242
FDR Memorial, Part Two.flavor_text: With the Capitol busy scrambling to repair their security trenches, you realize they're more vulnerable than ever.Return to the Piecekeeper and tell them you'd like to infiltrate the stock market.

Air Force Memorial.name: Air Force Memorial
Air Force Memorial.address: 1 Air Force Memorial Dr, Arlington, VA 22204
Air Force Memorial.flavor_text:
Now that we've got the Capitol disoriented, we'd like to take their biggest asset: District 2. In order to do so, we'll need some good recon. Head to this lookout point and get the intel we need.

Drive to the Air Force memorial and park in the adjacent lot. Enter the memorial and look for the Piecekeeper who awaits you.

Iwo Jima Memorial.name: Iwo Jima Memorial
Iwo Jima Memorial.flavor_text: With a steady flow of new recruits to your cause it's now time the crack "The Nut".  Known by this moniker due to its well fortified nature, District 2 is a key asset in keeping the Capitol running.

Freedom Park.name: Freedom Park
Freedom Park.flavor_text: While you were occupied taking District 2, the Capitol has taken their own steps to end this war.  Showing a complete lack of compunction, Capitol troops have raided a children's hospital, taking hundreds of patients hostage.  This will not stand.  You need to mount a rescue mission immediately or our revolution ends here.

Smithsonian Castle South Garden.name: Smithsonian Castle South Garden
Smithsonian Castle South Garden.flavor_text: Now that you've shorn up your numbers with new Resistance members, it's finally time to take the Capitol! Make your way back to the Piecekeeper and tell them you're ready to invade the Capitol.

National Mall, Smithsonian Metro Exit.name: National Mall, Smithsonian Metro Exit
National Mall, Smithsonian Metro Exit.flavor_text:
Your final step awaits you as you confront the first of what you fear may be a series of defense pods, devices formerly used in past arenas, but repurposed as electronic guardians of the Capitol.

Find the statue in front of the red-bricked Smithsonian Castle, and look for the Piecekeeper.

National Mall, Smithsonian Castle Statue.name: National Mall, Smithsonian Castle Statue
National Mall, Smithsonian Castle Statue.flavor_text:
Along with your fellow Resistance members, you cautiously march towards the Capitol, readily aware that at any moment, another pod many spring up and take out your squad.

Head east down the Mall and stop at the Carousel.

National Mall, Carousel.name: National Mall, Carousel
National Mall, Carousel.flavor_text:
As you continue to approach the Capitol building, you are joined by more and more members of the Resistance. Still you must proceed with caution, as pods have been known to wipe out thousands in an instant.

Continue east down the Mall and stop at the top of the stairs to the sculpture garden.

National Mall, Sculpture Garden North En.name: National Mall, Sculpture Garden North Entrance
National Mall, Sculpture Garden North En.flavor_text:
You press onward, drawing closer to the Capitol. Even though these defenses are proving to be tougher than you expected, you must continue on. It's time to make your final push to the Capitol.

Cross 7th street and look for the Piecekeepers guarding the Capitol building.

National Mall, View of the Capitol.name: National Mall, View of the Capitol
National Mall, View of the Capitol.flavor_text: Through the efforts of your team and the thousands of fellow revolutionaries, it looks like all the pods have been disarmed.  Whew!  Before you is your ultimate destination--The Capitol. After all you've been through it's hard to believe that you're finally here.  Your "victory" in the arena seems ages ago.

Nando's Peri Peri Restaurant.name: Nando's Peri Peri Restaurant
Nando's Peri Peri Restaurant.flavor_text:
The best way to end famine is to go eat!

There might be street parking available, or you could also try one of several parking garages in Old Town. Try Courthouse Square Parking on South Pitt Street or Market Square Garage on 108 N Fairfax St.
